embeds.title: #Spireclips Automaton Ignores Champ to Read an Entire Library | Sla...
embeds.description:
For those who don't know this character:

Automaton's gimmick is combining 3 cards into 1 stronger card called a Function. The MVPs of this combo was an event card called Proto-Shield, which gives plated armor when making the function, and a power called Class Default, which copies the first card to be combined to the next 3 functions. Playing t...

messages.content: featuring old omnsicsience recolor background

this is a pretty good card but its use case is somewhat limited. Since there are no truly bad encode cards; this is giving you a good card for free every turn. It can go a long way in helping you spam functions in a long fight. But the issue this card has is that automation doesent really have long fights; like virus just 1 shots the entire game until act 4.

library also costs 3 energy which makes it even more unreasonable to play in hallway fights. You can acutally afford this in boss fights though which is what the card was made to be good in (as well as snecko eye of course).
this card is very similar to creative AI in its use case, although its on a much stronger character who has lots of scaling potential already making it a hard sell quite often despite its raw power.

CS joke:
import java.util.*;

Actual evaluation of card:
It's a way to keep spewing out functions after all your encodes have been used
Counts as infinite scaling because of boost, fortify, and philosophize
Generally too slow in regular fights, though can carry you through bosses
creative ai can give creative ai which is funny
this card can't so its less funny
also you have to play auto to see it

creative ai: can give creative ai
strike of genius: can give strike of genius
library and hello world: :(
iirc hello world used to be able to give itself
it also used to be able to give defrag
yep
strike of genius can't give strike of genius
was that patched out?
it used to be able to

It's a really good card, reliable one, as any other random card generation sorce is but at worse you're getting to fill up a slot in your function with something mediocre to speed up it's creation, at best you're getting something ready powerful that you get to play twice thanks to how functions work
It becomes a lot more reliable if you build your deck in a way that can deal with random compile errors you'll be encoding
It combos really well with <magietic coil> as compiling becomes less cumbersome with a steady stream of encodable cards

embeds.title: Electromagnetic Coil
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Automaton / Downfall

Functions are now made up of 4 cards.
*An inefficient but entertaining power source.*

messages.content: I still think it should be a shop relic

In my opinion library is the best our of the random card generation powers considering even at its worst it still provides a benefit to your deck whereas the other ones often end up filling your discard pile with garbage after just a few rounds

Auto doesn't really need extra scaling for long fights because its entire gimmick is a form of scaling. But if you're already ok for the short fights, and can cast this without tanking damage, extra scaling can't hurt. And the fact that it mostly can't give a bad card, and they effectively exhaust themselves, makes it better
I guess it could give the ones with compile errors that makes it unplayable or exhaust
Yea, but oftentimes sacrificing few other encodable cards isn't that big of a deal, with library you're going to be swimming in functions regardless
There's also <clean code> and <overheat>

embeds.description:

 (**Innate**.)
Remove the next 3 Compile Errors you would Encode.

embeds.title: Overheat
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 2 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

Deal 18 (24) damage.
Remove the next Compile Error you would Encode.

messages.content: Both solid cards on thier own
and <dev tools+>

my beloathed

you don't really take those unless you already have a card that needs them though. Except dev tools

like mental

mechanically sure. but it's so boring
Playable null pointer function is pretty cool if you ask me
On a unrelated note, imagine if gifts from beyond gave you afterlife cards every turn instead of reclaiming
dev tools is essentially "By the power of VSCode/IntelliJ, I break the game!"
*suspicious mwalls noises*
Imagine dying to a spiker because of it
this is how this card works now

I think this card is in a very odd place within automatons kit. It's a form of perpetual scaling through functions, but it's very slow and expensive. Automaton already naturally scales fairly well into the late game with functions, and can use sentient form as a generally more powerful and condensed way of going completely over the top of fights if it needs to. I think that the effect of library is quite powerful, but you are rarely going to need/want it because what it offers isn't often something you are lacking.

To be sure, pretty much every encode card is powerful, and stapling together more functions faster is very desirable. But outside of the very late stages of the game, I just don't see needing to put such a difficult to cast power into your deck. Snecko eye or mummified (really any cost reduction) can definitely make this more viable. If you do take it, you might want to invest in a few ways to remove bugs, since it can generate those cards, and you don't want to hurt your functions or leave them to junk up your deck. One of the better ways to enable electromagnetic coil (though both are pretty bad on their own, so it's rare that you would have one to support the other). I like the idea and overall balance of this card, but I really question it's utility on a character with so much innate scaling baked into its kit. Creative AI for defect makes more sense because of the "power spam" archetype, and because that class has so much potential for multiplicative scaling (usually with orbs) if they can assemble the right mixture of powers. Defect also can stall more easily using frost/focus to give creative AI time to generate the right/enough powers, and I don't think automaton is as capable at doing that kind of stalling for library.
auto can make quadratic scaling using library and fine tuning/sentient form
but they generally do not need it
EW
